text: hi my name is Damien Chazelle I wrote
and directed whiplash this is the
opening sequence it was important to me
you know right away the way movies begin
is so crucial to me it's that moment
where you really have the audience
totally spellbound you haven't lost them
yet the lights in the theater have just
gone down I think a lot of movies almost
kind of waste their opening a few
seconds it's the most critical moment
and and so I wanted to begin right away
with sir the thesis statement of filmic
waiting the sound of a drum which we're
hearing now is her single stroke roll
mounting with with warfare you know
there's something inherently military
about about the snare drum and about the
drum set in general and it spoke to what
I wanted this movie to speak about which
is which is musicianship the challenges
of musicianship but the ways that that
can bleed over into cruelty into
suffering in humanity and fear dread so
the tone was also important to establish
right away I wanted that single stroke
roll to feel to just get you on edge
right away and I wanted this shot here
to be lit and and timed in such a way
that we immediately sent a a certain
undercurrent of dread but this was not
just going to be a movie about the joys
of musicianship but there was constantly
going to be a sort of an undercurrent of
Menace and we're about to see that
menace personified just now as miles
